trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> objects that can be individually accessed by index.

Except as noted, members of this class behave exactly as described by the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>, <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601>, and <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> documentation.

**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> class provides several special features: <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.

For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
XAML Implicit Collection Usage
XAML Values
*oneOrMorePathSegmentObjectElements*
One or more <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegment> objects, declared using object element syntax.
Initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> class with the specified collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> objects.
The collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> objects that make up the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
collection is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> class with the specified capacity, or the number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> objects the collection is initially capable of storing.
The number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> objects that the collection is initially capable of storing.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> to the end of the collection.
Because <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegment> objects derive from <xref:System.Windows.Freezable>, they are copied when they are used.

Therefore, you might not be able to later retrieve or remove the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegment> you added to the collection using the original <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegment> object; the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegment> in the collection is a copy of the original <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegment> and is considered a different <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegment> than the one you added.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601.Add%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to add a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The segment to add to the collection.
value is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Clears the collection of all segments and resets <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Count"></xref> to zero.
This method does not change the capacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Returns a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> is contained within the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> to search for.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> is contained within the collection; otherwise, `false`.

Copies the entire <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> to a one-dimensional <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The array into which the collection's items are to be copied.
The index of array at which to start copying the contents of the .
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of items in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Gets the number of path segments contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
The number of path segments contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the collection.
Enumerators only allow reading the data in the collection.
Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first item in the collection.
also brings the enumerator back to this position.
At this position, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> throws an exception.

Therefore, you must call <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> to advance the enumerator to the first item of the collection before reading the value of <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> returns the same object until either <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Reset%2A> is called.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> sets <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> to the next item.

After the end of the collection is passed, the enumerator is positioned after the last item in the collection, and calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> returns `false`.

If the last call to <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> returned `false`, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> throws an exception.

To set <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> to the first item of the collection again, you can call <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Reset%2A> followed by <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A>.
An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged.

If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting items, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Reset%2A> throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

If the collection is modified between <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> will return the item that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.
To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection.Enumerator"></xref> that can iterate through the collection.
Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref>.
The item to search for.
The index of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref>.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> into this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> at the specified index.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Insert%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to insert a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The index at which to insert value, the specified .
The item to insert.
value is `null`.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> at the specified zero-based index.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Item%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to insert a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> object to get or set.
The item at the specified index.
value is `null`.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
The item to remove from this collection.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> is removed from the collection; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> is read-only.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegment"></xref> at the specified index from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
The index of the item to remove.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1.IsReadOnly"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601> interface.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
A zero-based <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
The first position in the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to receive the copied contents.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which to insert the <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref>.

This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathSegmentCollection"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.

The element at the specified index.
